channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Are there lessons for the U.S. in this European country's struggle with measles?
item.description: In 2024, Romania, an upper middle income European country, had over 30,000 cases — putting it on the world's top ten measles list. Its vaccination rate hovers around 60%. How did this happen?
item.content:encoded:
In 2024, Romania, an upper middle income European country, had over 30,000 cases — putting it on the world's top ten measles list. Its vaccination rate hovers around 60%. How did this happen?

(Image credit: Daniel Mihailescu)
item.dc:creator: Michal Ruprecht

item.title: CDC claims vaccines may cause autism. And, Trump and Mamdani to meet today
item.description: The CDC claims, without evidence, that vaccines may cause autism. And, New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani heads to the White House, where he will meet the president for the first time.
item.content:encoded:
The CDC claims, without evidence, that vaccines may cause autism. And, New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani heads to the White House, where he will meet the president for the first time.

(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Brain scientists are seeking weight-loss drugs without the nausea
item.description: Weight-loss drugs like Wegovy and Zepbound often cause nausea and other side effects. Brain scientists are looking for ways to solve this problem.
item.content:encoded:
Weight-loss drugs like Wegovy and Zepbound often cause nausea and other side effects. Brain scientists are looking for ways to solve this problem.

(Image credit: blackCAT/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: This weekend, artists are speaking out across the country
item.description: Artists in more than 40 states are spending Friday and Saturday participating in the "Fall of Freedom" – which they say represents a creative resistance to authoritarianism.
item.content:encoded:
Artists in more than 40 states are spending Friday and Saturday participating in the "Fall of Freedom" – which they say represents a creative resistance to authoritarianism.

(Image credit: JP Yim)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: Russian hacking suspect wanted by the FBI arrested on Thai resort island
item.description: Thai Police have arrested a suspected Russian hacker who is wanted by the FBI for alleged cyberattacks on U.S. and European government agencies.
item.content:encoded:
Thai Police have arrested a suspected Russian hacker who is wanted by the FBI for alleged cyberattacks on U.S. and European government agencies.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What former ally did Trump call a 'ranting Lunatic' this week? Find out in the quiz
item.description: This week, the quiz examines truth, drugs and scandal!
item.content:encoded: This week, the quiz examines truth, drugs and scandal!
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Rare earths: Federal backing and tech advances aim to help the U.S. catch up to China
item.description: Rare earths aren't all that rare. The real choke point is in processing and refining them, where China enjoys market dominance.
item.content:encoded:
Rare earths aren't all that rare. The real choke point is in processing and refining them, where China enjoys market dominance.

(Image credit: ‎)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: How could Trump interfere in the midterms? Here's what voting officials are watching
item.description: Less than a year from the midterm elections, state and local voting officials from both major political parties are actively preparing for the possibility of interference by the Trump administration.
item.content:encoded:
Less than a year from the midterm elections, state and local voting officials from both major political parties are actively preparing for the possibility of interference by the Trump administration.

(Image credit: Stephen Maturen)
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: In Miami Beach, the New York City mayoral election is an opportunity
item.description: Billboards in Times Square are inviting New York businesses to relocate to Miami Beach. They're being paid for by a Florida developer who sees the election of Zohran Mamdani as an opportunity to lure residents and businesses south.
item.content:encoded:
Billboards in Times Square are inviting New York businesses to relocate to Miami Beach. They're being paid for by a Florida developer who sees the election of Zohran Mamdani as an opportunity to lure residents and businesses south.

(Image credit: Steven Meiner)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: After calling him a 'communist,' Trump will meet Mamdani in the Oval Office Friday
item.description: New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani will meet with President Trump at the White House Friday putting the frequent foe of conservatives face-to-face with one of his biggest critics.
item.content:encoded:
New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani will meet with President Trump at the White House Friday putting the frequent foe of conservatives face-to-face with one of his biggest critics.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds/Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore
